intro: Anthyllis vulneraria var. alba, commonly known as the white kidney vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in dry, sandy, or rocky soils. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. This species is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion.
